sense.name: written typographical text in a document
sense.examples: The print at the bottom of the page is too small to read easily. The heading of each section in the paper was in bold print.

sense.name: reproduction of a painting or engraving
sense.examples: Only 100 signed prints will be made of this woodblock. A framed print of Van Gogh's painting 'Sunflowers' hung over Sally's couch.

sense.name: a visible impression on a physical surface
sense.examples: We saw prints in the snow that were probably made by a rabbit. The burglar carefully wiped his prints off the doorknob. Mary was angered by the lipstick prints on John's collar. This crime has the print of Al Capone all over it. (metaphoric extension)

sense.name: writing that has been published, available as publication
sense.examples: We've got to get this story into print by Monday. That book is currently out of print. Is that edition of the work still in print?

sense.name: copy of a film or motion picture, made from a master
sense.examples: This is the only known remaining print of his 1934 film noir. Prints of the new movie were distributed to theaters.

sense.name: a pattern or design on a fabric
sense.examples: Jane selected a geometric print for her new living room curtains. The prints on these men's ties are too loud for my taste. The couch was reupholstered in a floral print.

sense.name: photographic copy produced from a negative
sense.examples: This store will process your prints in about an hour. Mary ordered extra prints of her son's class picture.

sense.name: the publishing industry
sense.examples: John's uncle was a print worker for 20 years. The print unions are going on strike in New York.
